Detailed Description

Class loader.

Abstract class to load other classfiles

Author:
Oscar van Eijk, Oveas Functionality Provider
Version:
Oct 7, 2010 -- O van Eijk -- Initial version for OWL-PHP

static OWLloader::getArea ( $  _classFile,
$  _classLocation 
) [static]

Load a contentarea. This is done by calling the loadArea() method of the given class.

Parameters:
[in] $_classFile Name of the classfile. This must the full filename without '.php' The name must be equal to the name of the class without 'Area in camelcase, so if the name of the classfile is 'myspot.php', the classname must be 'MyspotArea' and this argument must be 'myspot'
[in] $_classLocation Full path specification (can be as a constant) where the file can be found
Returns:
Reference to the object which is an instantiation of the class.
static OWLloader::getClass ( $  _className,
$  _classLocation = array(OWL_SO_INC, OWL_BO_INC, OWL_UI_INC),
$  _loadMultiple = false 
) [static]

Load a PHP classfile

Parameters:
[in] $_className Name of the class; either file full name (<filename.php> or the identifying name ([class.]<name>[.php])
[in] $_classLocation (Array of) location(s) where to look for the class
[in] $_loadMultiple Boolean; by default, the first matching classname will be loaded. Set this to true to load all files with the same name from multiple locations
Returns:
True on success
